name: 3.14 "The Heart is a Lonely Snipehunter" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: What song did they all start singing?
questions.correct: The Sunny Side of the Street
questions.explanation:
The Sunny Side of the Street.

	The lyrics to the song are as follows: "Grab your coat and get your hat Leave your worries on the doorstep Life can be so sweet On the sunny side of the street  Can't you hear the pitter-pat And that happy tune is your step Life can be complete On the sunny side of the street  I used to walk in the shade with my blues on parade But I'm not afraid...this rovers crossed over  If I never had a cent I'd be rich as Rockefeller Gold dust at my feet On the sunny side of the street"

questions.text: What was the smell they all smelled?
questions.explanation:
Coach smoking a cigar.

	Coach said he could smell it the most because it was right under his nose. However, he refused to stop smoking.

questions.text: Where were the Cheers men going?
questions.explanation:
fishing.

	Coach did not go with the other men. He told Carla that he couldn't stand the smell of the guys.

questions.text: What did Frasier say was the only thing that would make his job worse?
questions.correct: if he actually listened to his patients
options: if he only got paid $25 an hour
questions.explanation:
if he actually listened to his patients.

	On more than one occasion, Frasier implied he did not really care about his patients. Frasier was a Freudian psychiatrist.

questions.text: Who had Sam take Frasier fishing?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	Diane thought that time with the guys would improve Frasier's morale. Sam didn't want to have him go but eventually agreed.

questions.text: Who got left in the woods?
questions.explanation:
Frasier.

	The guys tricked Fraiser. They left him in the woods and returned to Cheers.

questions.text: What was the man left behind hunting for?
questions.explanation:
snipe.

	Frasier was determined to catch that snipe. The others didn't want to stay around while he tried.

questions.text: Why did the guys find Frasier's hunting to be so funny?
questions.correct: There's no such thing as a snipe
options: It was a salt water fish and they were on fresh water
It was a fresh water fish and they were on salt water
questions.explanation:
There's no such thing as a snipe.

	Diane was upset that they left Frasier in the woods. Sam said it was a rite of passage that all guys go through. He then said he however did not go through it.

questions.text: When did Sam say was the best time to hunt for snipe?
questions.explanation:
when there's a full moon.

	The guys even went so far as to invent a snipe call to catch the snipe. Diane told them they had to tell Frasier the truth, until she saw how happy Frasier was, then she wouldn't allow them to tell him the truth.

questions.text: Did Frasier know it was a joke?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	He told Diane that he figured out there was no such thing as a snipe but he was planning to get back at the guys. He didn't tell her because he figured she'd blab.
